reference_summary:
Haunted Castle
Jasper Steverlinck  (Actor),     Kyoko Baertsoen  (Actor),     Ben Stassen  (Director, Editor, Producer, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Animation
['Product Description', 'A young musician is summoned to his mother', 'Amazon.com', 'Without question, 3-D technology has come a long way since the days of red and green cardboard glasses, and', 'Haunted Castle', 'offers delectable proof. This half-hour digitally animated feature--also available in', 'The Ultimate 3-D Collection', ', which includes two other films and the H3D "i-glasses" hardware needed to generate the 3-D imaging--tells the story of a young rock star facing the Faustian offer to sell his soul for fame and fortune.', 'The tale is a foil for the effects, of course, but a decent foil with above-par music and excellent animation and effects, from torches to trees, gargoyles to guitars. The sound is terrific, enhancing the sense of depth with a seamless DTS surround-sound mix that works well even in headphones.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'From the Back Cover', "A young musician is summoned to his mother's castle in accordance with her final wishes. Upon his arrival, Johnny quickly discovers that things are not as they appear. The castle begins to come alive as materializing spirits lead him to Mephisto (voiced by Harry Shearer), the ghoulish henchman to Mr. D (also Harry Shearer), who makes Johnny a tantalizing offer. The same offer that his mother accepted over twenty years earlier: surrender your soul in exchange for fame and fortune.", 'Experience a whirling visual thrill ride as Johnny explores the underworld of the castle to the explosive climax where Johnny confronts Mr. D and fights to free his mother/s spirit.', 'See more']
{'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '8 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '17078926323', 'Director': 'Ben Stassen', 'Media Format': 'Color, Animated, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Live, Dolby, 3D', 'Run time': '38 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 16, 2001', 'Actors': 'Jasper Steverlinck, Kyoko Baertsoen, Harry Shearer', 'Producers': 'Ben Stassen, Caroline Van Iseghem, Charlotte Huggins', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Sling Shot', 'Writers': 'Ben Stassen, Kurt Frey', 'Number of discs': '1'}
I could not play it on my 3D player because it is not blu ray.  Was a little disapointed but got over it.
Love this movie except ...
The Polar Express Presented in 3-D
Hanks, Tom  (Actor),     Deezen, Eddie  (Actor)    Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
['Product description', "All aboard - 3-D! No matter if you enjoy The Polar Express every holiday or if you're a first-time passenger, get ready for a thrilling new adventure: Three-dimension viewing [Disc 1] - from careening up and down mountains to teetering across mile-high bridges to savoring hot chocolate served up by the world's most talented singing waiters to arriving at the North Pole on Christmas Eve. Experience an amazing new dimension of fun!. Tom Hanks stars in and Robert Zemeckis directs the instant holiday classic filmed in dazzling performance capture animation that makes every moment magical. And there's more: a two-dimension version [Disc 2] for you to enjoy without your 3-D glasses. Twice the adventure, many times the fun - all aboooooard!. ***4 Pairs of Special 3-D Glasses Inside!. Format: DVD MOVIE. Genre: FAMILY. Rating: G. Age: 883929036660. UPC: 883929036660. Manufacturer No: 1000042431", 'Amazon.com', 'Destined to become a holiday perennial,', 'The Polar Express', 'also heralded a brave new world of all-digital filmmaking. Critics and audiences were divided between those who hailed it as an instant classic that captures the visual splendor and evocative innocence of Chris Van Allsburg\'s popular children\'s book, and those who felt that the innovative use of "performance capture"--to accurately translate live performances into all-digital characters--was an eerie and not-quite-lifelike distraction from the story\'s epic-scale North Pole adventure. In any case it\'s a benign, kind-hearted celebration of the yuletide spirit, especially for kids who have almost grown out of their need to believe in Santa Claus. Tom Hanks is the nominal "star" who performs five different computer-generated characters, but it\'s the visuals that steal this show, as director Robert Zemeckis indulges his tireless pursuit of technological innovation. No matter how you respond to the many wonders on display, it\'s clear that The Polar Express represents a significant milestone in the digital revolution of cinema. If it also fills you with the joy of Christmas (in spite of its Nuremberg-like rally of frantic elves), so much the better.', '--Jeff Shannon']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests**: The user has a strong preference for animated films in the science fiction and fantasy genres, valuing innovative visual effects and compelling narratives that engage audiences. They also express an enthusiasm for series content, as seen in their latest purchase.

- **Formats**: Primarily enjoying DVD formats, the user appreciates 3D technology, demonstrated by recent purchases featuring 3D options. They express disappointment when non-Blu-ray content is incompatible with a 3D player, highlighting a desire for high-quality viewing experiences.

- **Narrative Themes**: The user favors stories that explore fame, fortune, and the supernatural, particularly those involving character journeys with personal sacrifice and moral dilemmas. Their enjoyment of both standalone films and series indicates a broad appreciation for engaging narratives.

- **Entertainment Rating**: Tending to rate films and series positively, the user is willing to overlook minor format issues when the content exceeds expectations. Their recent engagement shows a strong affinity for narrative drive and character development.

- **User Behavior**: Actively engages with products through reviews, sharing experiences that influence others' perceptions. Their feedback reflects a commitment to storytelling, a positive affinity for holiday classics, and an emerging interest in serialized content, as evidenced by their excitement for continuing series narratives.

Overall, the user values immersive storytelling in animated features and series alike while exhibiting selective preferences for formats that enhance their viewing enjoyment.
